title: Life and Correspondence of David Hume, Volume I (of 2)
author: Burton, John Hill
snippet: [12:1] Among the Hume Papers in the possession of the Royal Society ofEdinburgh, there is a letter from the chevalier, addressed to "Monsieurde Ramsay, a l'Hotel de Provence, Rue de Conde, Faubourg St. Germain,"dated 1st September, 1742. The receiver of this letter was probably thecorrespondent of Hume, to whom it may have been sent, under theimpression that he was the person connected with the Vindication of theDuchess of Marlborough, a book now well known to have been put intoshape by Hooke, the historian of Rome.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: He was at this time painting Sir Walter for the Royal Society ofEdinburgh. When the portrait was finished it was placed in the rooms ofthe Society, where it still hangs.

title: Rambles in Europe in 1839. With sketches of prominent surgeons, physicians, medical schools, hospitals, literary personages, scenery, etc
author: Gibson, William
snippet: * See oration delivered before the members of the Royal Society ofEdinburgh, at the celebration of iheir Centenary, February 17th, 1837,by W. B. Carpenter, senior president of ihe society, &c.
